title: Mystery surrounds the murder of heavily-tattooed bikie and founder of MONSTR Clothing
text:
A fashion designer bikie boss was shot in the head and his friend killed in a high-speed car crash just hours after sharing a beer at a Gold Coast pub.

Shane Ross, who founded Monstr clothing and was a patched Comanchero bikie, was murdered sometime on Friday night around the time his friend Cameron Martin veered off the road and into trees.

Martin's body was found at 9pm Friday in Tullebudgera after the single-vehicle crash in which his Mercedes Benz hit trees which such force they snapped in half.

Ross's body was found in a popular Gold Coast park in Burleigh Heads at about 1.30pm Monday - a week after being convicted over a car fraud syndicate.

Comanchero bikie and Monstr Clothing founder Shane Ross (pictured) has been found dead in a Gold Coast park

Police sources confirmed to The Gold Coast Bulletin that he had been shot in the head.

Ross, 36, had been missing since Friday night after being spotted drinking with Martin, 47, at a nearby tavern.

Police have confirmed they are investigating if the two deaths are connected, bikie links and if drugs played a part.

Investigations by detectives suggest Ross met with a group of people in the same park where he was killed.

Detectives are now focusing on the pairs' movements in the two hours between when they were at the tavern and when the car crash was discovered.

A woman who lives nearby to the park said she heard multiple gunshots on Friday night.

'It was two successions, like bang, bang, bang, and then again. We heard ambulances rush past. I said to my husband 'that sounded like gun shots. We then thought it was from the crash. It was all the same time,' the woman told The Gold Coast Bulletin.

Queensland Police Acting Superintendent Brendan Smith told reporters at the scene that police are treating Ross' death as suspicious.

'I can say who we believe this person is and the victim of the fatal are friends and were seen together on Friday,' Supt Smith said, as reported by the Gold Coast Bulletin.

'That is certainly one line of inquiry we are going to run out — it would be coincidental if both incidents aren't connected,' Supt Smith said.

Comanchero bikie and Monstr Clothing founder Shane Ross (left) was shot in the head within hours of his friend Cameron Martin (right) perishing in a high speed car crash

Both men were motor sport enthusiasts with ties to gym and motor sport brand Monstr Clothing.

Ross was recently convicted for his role in an alleged luxury car fraud syndicate and was sentenced to an 18-month intensive corrections order.

Police claim that Ross and his alleged conspirators used false documentation to secure loans for luxury cars before selling the vehicles for profit.
description: Comanchero bikie and Monstr Clothing founder Shane Ross (left) was shot in the head within moments of his friend perishing in a high speed car crash on the Gold Coast.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
